title: 2022 Ford GT ’64 Heritage Edition
description: This 2022 Ford GT is a '64 Heritage Edition example built in commemoration of the 1964 Ford GT prototypes that led to Ford's victories at Le Mans between 1966 and 1969. It was purchased new by the seller from Southbay Ford in Hawthorne, California, and now has 148 miles. Finished in Wimbledon White with an over-the-top stripe and exposed carbon-fiber accents, it is powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.5-liter EcoBoost V6 paired with a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. It is equipped with an Akrapovič titanium exhaust system, blue-accented 20″ carbon-fiber wheels, Brembo carbon-ceramic brakes, butterfly doors, a retractable active rear wing, a rear diffuser, a titanium tow hook, gloss carbon-fiber exterior trim, six-point harness anchors, and Lightspeed Blue Alcantara upholstery. Nearly $8k in clear paint-protection film has been applied to the bodywork. This Ford GT is now offered with manufacturer's literature, a car cover, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller's name.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 2022 Ford GT ’64 Heritage Edition at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #194,059.
text: This 2022 Ford GT is a ’64 Heritage Edition example built in commemoration of the 1964 Ford GT prototypes that led to Ford’s victories at Le Mans between 1966 and 1969. It was purchased new by the seller from Southbay Ford in Hawthorne, California, and now has 148 miles. Finished in Wimbledon White with an over-the-top stripe and exposed carbon-fiber accents, it is powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.5-liter EcoBoost V6 paired with a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. It is equipped with an Akrapovič titanium exhaust system, blue-accented 20″ carbon-fiber wheels, Brembo carbon-ceramic brakes, butterfly doors, a retractable active rear wing, a rear diffuser, a titanium tow hook, gloss carbon-fiber exterior trim, six-point harness anchors, and Lightspeed Blue Alcantara upholstery. Nearly $8k in clear paint-protection film has been applied to the bodywork. This Ford GT is now offered with manufacturer’s literature, a car cover, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name. The Chris Svensson-designed second-generation GT debuted at the 2015 North American International Auto Show and entered production in December 2016 at Multimatic’s Markham, Ontario, assembly facility. This example is finished in a Wimbledon White Heritage ’64 livery with exposed carbon-fiber accents. Additional features include LED headlights, a lightweight Gorilla Glass windshield, butterfly doors, a retractable active rear wing, LED taillights, a rear diffuser, and carbon-fiber exterior trim. The GT features a carbon-fiber monocoque structure bolted to front and rear aluminum subframes that serve as stressed members for the hydraulically adjustable pushrod suspension system. Variable ride height, a front-axle lift system, selectable driving modes, and launch control are standard features. Clear paint-protection film has been applied to the bodywork at a cost of nearly $8k. Blue-accented 20″ gloss carbon-fiber wheels feature blue accents and are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport Cup 2 tires measuring 245/35 up front and 325/30 at the rear. Braking is handled by silver-painted Brembo six-piston monoblock calipers over 15.5” carbon-ceramic discs up front, while four-piston calipers are mounted over 14.1” units out back. The cabin features Lightspeed Blue Alcantara over the Sparco seats, which have manually reclining carbon-fiber shells, and exposed carbon fiber is visible on the door panels. The fixed-position driver seat is paired with an adjustable pedal box and steering column, and additional equipment includes automatic climate control, six-point harness anchors, and a touchscreen infotainment system. The Alcantara-wrapped Heritage steering wheel fronts paddle shifters and a configurable digital instrument panel. The digital odometer indicates 148 miles. The mid-mounted twin-turbocharged 3.5L EcoBoost V6 features a carbon-fiber engine cover and an Akrapovič exhaust system. It was factory rated at 660 horsepower and 550 lb-ft of torque, which is sent to the rear wheels via a Getrag seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. Carbon-fiber aero panels are fitted fore and aft. The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage. The listed lien was released in February 2025.
